metadata.category: Building a Membership Card App with PassKit
metadata.title: Introduction to PassKit & Wallet

inlineContent.text: Understand the core concepts of the PassKit framework and
the features provided by the Wallet app.
PassKit is a framework that interacts with Apple’s Wallet app.
: Membership cards, tickets, coupons, boarding passes, etc.
Supported from iOS 6, now available on all Apple platforms.
Wallet may be disabled in some regions or devices.
Wallet supports various types of passes.
Each type provides layout and features suited to its purpose.
Display style in Wallet varies by pass type.
Membership card apps typically use the
Use PKPassLibrary to manage user’s passes.
Operations like add, delete, update are available.
You can check if the user already has a pass.
Prevents duplicate additions and improves UX.
Apple Pay is a secure contactless payment system.
It uses tokenized information instead of actual card numbers.
: Device Account Number protects real card info
: Fast authentication with Face ID / Touch ID
The device must support NFC and have payment cards registered.
Display standard Apple Pay buttons with PKPaymentButton.
Provides design following Human Interface Guidelines.
What are the two main features provided by the PassKit framework?
PassKit handles both Wallet passes (membership, tickets, etc.)
Pass management and Apple Pay payments
but this is an additional feature, not core functionality.
Photos and documents are handled by PhotosUI and VisionKit respectively.
What is the most appropriate pass type for creating a membership card?
boardingPass is suited for airline or train tickets.
storeCard is optimized for membership cards, point cards,
eventTicket is suited for one-time events

and data of a membership card.
